Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with very good service”
Reviews.Author: Tanya19
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in Paris for a business trip and he had selected Hotel Chatillon for our stay. I was pleasantly surprised considering some of the reviews I had read on another site. That said, I believe the reviews predated the renovations undertaken at the hotel. We had a double room with a well-kitted out bathroom with a soaker tub. The bathroom had obviously been redone. The rooms were fairly quiet but not completely soundproofed. Also, there was work being done on the facade of the hotel so, if we were working in the room during the afternoon, we had to keep the window closed to minimize the noise. Wifi is available at no extra charge but if you need to use it for several days you'll need to get the password each day. Breakfast is also available at the hotel for 9€, which is not bad considering the offering: half a baguette with butter and jam, cheese, viennoiserie (usually a croissant or pain au chocolat), fruit juice, and coffee/hot chocolate/tea. The service from the hotel staff was also very courteous and professional. The only downside to the hotel may be the location. There isn't much to do in the 14th arrondissement but, fortunately, the hotel is located close to a metro station and the tram.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, good service”
Reviews.Author: JackBauer1957
Reviews.Content: We had a great stop over with a super room is a great location, excellent friendly staff. Would stay again, reasonable value too.

Reviews.Title: “RUN, do not walk to this hotel! Book now! It's great.”
Reviews.Author: Peggy M
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for a few days in October. It was friggen awesome. The room is large and Julien at the front desk helped us with whatever our needs of the day were! We made a weak attempt to speak basic French phrases and everyone was so helpful. This hotel is beautiful at such a fantastic rate. SUPER DUPER clean with a large comfortable bed. Nice view, close to everything in Montparnasse and a 15 minute cab or subway ride to all the sights. The subway is very close and very easy to manuever. Wish we had had more time to stay. Again, Julien was the BEST!!

Reviews.Title: “An extremely good find in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Heath L
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Chatillon at the end of September 2011 for 6 nights - 3 of which were for business, and 3 then for pleasure. Let's keep things relatively simple. The downsides: - It's not all that cheap at €140/night rack rate for a 3* hotel, but then Paris is expensive at the best of times, and the £/€ exchange rate is pretty poor at the moment. - I could barely access the free wireless internet up on the 6th floor (room 62). This wasn't too much of an issue for the second half of my stay, but while I was working it's a fairly essential feature. I managed to cobble together a weak signal by remotely tethering my smartphone, giving me some much needed flexibility in picking up the network. This problem may be confined to the 6th floor only, I've no idea. This could be easily solved by adding a few extra routers so that there's one on each floor. - The breakfast isn't really brilliant value at €8. I'd much rather grab something from one of the nearby patisseries, but some people (like the below reviewer) may find the opposite - it just depends on your outlook, really. And the upsides, which far outweigh the downsides. - It was exceptionally clean and the room was well tended every day. - The room was a decent size for Paris. Sure, if you're used to US room sizes, it's going to be a shock to the system, but this is Paris and rooms are small, so it felt relatively roomy for the two of us! - It has been recently refurbished. Some of the traveller photos I've seen on here are very different to how the rooms are now. It's a huge change and really makes it feel like a nice place to be. - The staff are fantastic. I can't praise them highly enough. - The location is pretty good - a leisurely 5 minute walk up the road to the Alesia Metro station, very easy to find (two stops and you're at RER B with its links to Gare Du Nord, CDG etc.). The walk to the Jean Moulin tube/Porte D'Orleans tube and metro stations down the road is even shorter. Plenty of places to eat and drink nearby if you don't want to head further afield. I had an awesome steak at the very unassuming looking Jardins Contini a couple of minutes walk on from the Alesia Metro station on Av. du General Leclerc. - The location is also nice and quite - just off Av. Jean Moulin in a quiet street with very little activity. It was 30+ degrees while we were there, and save for a rubbish collection in the morning, there was no noise in the vicinity, even with the windows wide open. I've probably forgotten some of the other plus points - there really were lots of them. I'm not quite sure about the experience of the earlier reviewer - the €8 breakfast option was clearly conveyed and the option was there to take it or leave it on a daily basis. All in all, I'd have absolutely no hesitation in heading back to Hotel Chatillon - it's fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem, off the beaten track, recommended”
Reviews.Author: Matt365
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well-kept and quiet, being set back from the main road in a quiet little cobbled square, which also makes it a little trickier to find than other hotels. We found the staff to be friendly, courteous, smartly dressed and well-organised. The hotel itself is well-maintained and although not luxuriously decorated, still looks appealing on the inside and out. The breakfast dining room was very nice and we actually found preferable for a quiet coffee and croissant than local cafes, unless you want to people-watch in a busier area, or get some fancier pastries. The room we had was simple but smart and clean, and a good size for Paris - the furniture was of a pretty good standard and was modern and all matched, with the added bonus of a decent LCD TV and a safe in the wardrobe. The bathroom looked newly renovated and was decorated to a good standard. It's a short walk (10 minutes or so) to the nearest metro, Porte d'Orleans, which also has a tram stop, although you can walk up to Alesia which is a couple of minutes further in the other direction. There are plenty of bars, brasseries and patisseries nearby. We had no problems with noise, and in fact found the place to be very quiet with regard to street noise - we slept with the window open no problem. We could hear a little of other rooms, but no more so than any other hotel I've been to. I think this is a good value paris hotel, especially if you get a good last minute deal - we got a double room for more than €20 per night cheaper than the standard rate.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Lance M
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a quaint little square. Staff were very helpful and compassionate with the fact our French was poor. They did laugh at our attempts. Easy stroll to Metro at Alesia past some very tempting Patisseries and cafes. Room was neat and clean and beds were very comfortable. We paid 84 Euro a night and felt the value for money was outstanding. If in Paris again would not hesitate to stay here. Down load directions before going or you could wander for a while trying to find the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but bring your ear plugs”
Reviews.Author: etl2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located couple of hundred meters from the nearest metro station. It's within easy walking distance if you don't have too much luggage with you. There is also a supermarket nearby. The hotel itself was quite ok for a Parisian hotel, nothing special, neat enough and the staff helpful enough but not very active. The biggest downside was that all noise from neighboring rooms came through. I'd rather sleep than listen how some (drunken) tourists are quarreling. We asked for another room, but the hotel was said to be full. So: ear plugs on and try to sleep. We survived, but I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Inka_TO
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights at the end of June. It's a tastefully and simply decorated hotel, newly renovated, situated in a residential area in a quiet little square. The room was very very clean and comfortable. Although the hotel has no air conditioner, we didn't need it. The French windows allowed plenty of cool air through at night. The hotel offers free Wi-Fi and breakfast for 8Euro/person (we didn't try though). Nearby, there is a supermarket and lots of eating options (including KFC and a great bakery/cafe). No eating is allowed in the room but you could bring your food to their dinning room. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The only thing is this hotel is not centrally located. It is a 3 minute walk to Metro Alesia (second last stop on the southern end of line 4). It takes about 15 minutes with 1 line change to get to the very central station in Paris. To go to Eiffel Tower, it would be around 30 minutes. I didn't mind riding the metro for 15~30 minutes to get to wherever I needed to go to. This charming hotel is so affordable b/c of its less than central location. On heading to the hotel for the first time, I suggest printing out the hotel's location from Google Map so could see all the side streets, otherwise it could be just a little difficult to find. Overall, excellnt value, lovely hotel, I would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is in a very quiet location and the room was quite spacious”
Reviews.Author: rodleigh
Reviews.Content: My 84yo aunt and I stayed here for a weekend in May 2011, taking a twin room. The locaation was very quiet when compared to the hustle/bustle of Paris generally. The room had plenty of room when compared to others of same rating / price in Paris. As we were in Paris to see relatives we didn't use the Metro, but it was noted that it was not far away from the hotel. So although the hotel is a little isolated from the general sightseeing areas they would be easily accessed by public transport. The only downside is a general comment about hotels in mainland Europe is having no way of making a cuppa in the rooms, having to rely on going out for a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jilkat
Reviews.Content: As star ratings tend to be variable and we weren't sure how from the main centre this hotel was we were not sure what we were going to, but we were pleasantly impressed. The staff were welcoming, the room was clean and well decorated, the shower / toilet area looked like it had just been decorated and was lovely! It's a 15 minute walk to the central area of Paris and 5 minute walk from the nearest metro so it was easy to get about either by foot or Metro. Plenty of restraurants/brasseries/bars within a few minutes walk as well. We were very happy with our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet room, lovely hosts.”
Reviews.Author: pfraser
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at Hotel Chatillon, choosing it because of good reviews on tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. Even though our French is pretty non-existent, our hosts were gracious, friendly, and helpful. The nicely decorated room did not have air conditioning, but we did not need it as the windows opened to lovely street views. It was one of my favorite places that we stayed on our trip because it was what I imagined a small hotel in Paris would be. And we got great advice on a nearby bakery so our men at home received yummy pastries that night. (Note: pastries are difficult to get home from Paris but WORTH it!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel but prices will strongly increase from september 2010”
Reviews.Author: egosum75
Reviews.Content: Chatillon hotel was always among my first choices for staying in the 14th of Paris. No particular problems. I always paid less than 100 Euros a night. Rooms and bathrooms are bright and large. Still, there is no air conditioning, which makes you feel like sleeping in an oven during the hot days! Chatillon hotel is now a 3 stars hotel (from Sept. 2010) and its prices raised significantly : from 140 to 160 Euros a night... And still no air conditionning.

Reviews.Title: “Big problem with communication. Too far.”
Reviews.Author: Sevenstars4us
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my 70-year old mother to Paris for 3 days, and as we had to book last minute, I checked Trip Adviser, found this hotel with a special of 350 for 3 nights. So to secure the room and not mess about with the internet, I called and confirmed the available room with Gerard. However the price was 130 per night (so 390 for 3 nights) He explained that the reason for this price difference was was because we would be getting a recently remodeled room. We wanted the security of a room, so confirmed the higher price for the 'new' room. However, when we got there, while the room was nice, it did not seem like an upgraded room. We approached the nice lady at reception and she gave another explanation: that we are paying high season prices for the basic room, otherwise it would be even more. This did not go with the previous explanation (of the night before!), but we let it go. I mentioned to Gerard when I met him that that was not what he had said, but he said the lady had already explained to me about the high season, and dismissed further conversation on the matter. The first night we could not sleep due to heat wave and no fan in the room. Next morning, we asked Gerard if possible to have a small fan put in the room and were told of how rare to have this heat in Paris and that they do not have air conditioner and very difficult to obtain a fan, but would speak with owner. I just had the thought that I have been hearing of Paris heat waves for the last several years! But dare not mention it! The feeling I had was that our need for a fan was troublesome to them. Next night no fan in the room. We spoke to a very nice man at reception that night, Vincent, who gave us his own small personal fan for our use for the next two nights - this at least helped to move the air. The hotel itself is charming small hotel, clean, nice breakfast room, and good breakfast. it is several blocks from the subway/metro station. and almost at the end of that metro 4 line. Overall a good hotel. save these communication issues which left me feeling taken advantage of. TV only in French, no CNN or BBC for news. I would go there again if I had to, but will explore better options next time with time, closer at least.

Reviews.Title: “A charming french hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FedericaE
Reviews.Content: Really pleasant stay! The staff is competent and polite, the area incredibly calm and the place (room, hall, breakfast room) totally clean.. There is always a person at the reception day and night, you can sleep peacefully. The surroundings are nice : Alésia, Montparnasse, Denfert Rochereau : shopping, french "bistrots", parks... I really enjoyed the area!

Reviews.Title: “This Used to be a Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: rredge
Reviews.Content: I used to live in the neighbourhood where this hotel is located and I have stayed there several times since returning to North America. I once stayed there for five weeks. Under the previous owners, this was a very pleasant and reasonably priced place to stay. The owners were hands-on and they cared about their guests. The location is actually quite good if one knows the city and how to get around, although I understand why some people who are unfamiliar with Paris, or who want to be very central have expressed reservations about the locale. Unfortunately, the ownership has changed, we saw the new owners only briefly during our stay and the staff who actually run things leave a lot to be desired. The front desk clerk - the same one referred to in the review below - should not be in the hotel business. He comes off as a martinet, and he is both irritating and unhelpful. Equally importantly, we got quite a surprise when we received out bill, which did not accord with information on their web site. When we attempted to discuss this, the martinet decided to play gatekeeper between us and the manager and went into full blown bureaucratic mode. Rather than address the problem, he treated us to a lot of empty, evasive verbiage. The change in how this hotel is managed is very sad. I will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Customer Service in the world don't go there”
Reviews.Author: wabnikp
Reviews.Content: We went with 2 years old baby last october. The mange in the hotel Gerard is the example of the NON CUSTOMER SERVICE. Don't go to there with 500 Euros bills, you will not receive the change anywhere. All around the wolrd if you need to pay a hotel, the change is a problem of the hotel, the manger told me, go and find change somwhere.,...... The hotel is 8 blocks from the subway and at night you don't have to many option s to eat in the montparnasse zone. Next time in Paris, absolutely will not go there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: lilitour
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. We got a room in the 6th floor, double bed toilets and shower. It's a quiet environment, need to take a metro to the center. When we first arriived to the hotel the staff didn't speak english but when we checked out of the hotel the man in the reception was very nice and with good english. I think that in overall you get from the hotel what you need, for us it was good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfort at good price”
Reviews.Author: Shiregirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Chatillon for four nights. As others have commented its only 5 minutes away from Metro station in a good neighbourhood - although we noticed that the Alesia end of the road was much nicer than Porte D'Orleans. The rooms were immaculate & cleaned each day with new towels - housekeeping standards are best I've seen. I would recommend this hotel as a great simple hotel in Paris - we don't normally venture below 3-4 star hotels & were stunned at how good & cheap this 2 star one was.

Reviews.Title: “We had really good time here”
Reviews.Author: yogaolya
Reviews.Content: Very clean and nice hotel. It`s in 5 minutes walk to the metro station. The rooms aren't big, but nice. Big bathroom. Good service. No air in the room, but in that moment we didn't need in it. We didn't have a breakfast there. In the room, we had free wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “fine choice, great value, pleasant neighborhood in the southern 14th”
Reviews.Author: martinamis
Reviews.Content: booked here to help my daughter move into cite universitaire. staff was helpful, though had limited english. room was simple, clean, quiet. tv had no english channels. turned out to be a bit further from the cite campus than i expected, but was otherwise fine, and a great value at 85euros/night....free wi-fi connection was rather weak....

Reviews.Title: “great hotel - definately worth a try!”
Reviews.Author: phoebesjoanne
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for us as a surprise 40th birthday gift. After reading some very mixed reviews we were wondering what to expect. Fortunately we were very pleasantly surprised! This little hotel is very french in character which is what we liked - it is simple but spotlessly clean, and in a quiet location. Despite reviews stating how rude the staff were, we found them to be nothing but polite and helpful - perhaps due to the fact that we always made the effort to speak to them in their own language? We think it represents great value for money and would definately return. The only criticism perhaps is that it is in a suburb almost at the end of the metro line, but this did not pose a problem as the metro is so cheap and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly unpleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: karma_guard
Reviews.Content: We were going to celebrate our anniversary in Paris early December. We were incredibly excited and really looked forward to spending a nice, romantic and care-free weekend away. Now, we are a relatively young couple in our twenties and we really aren't that picky when it comes to places to stay after having backpacked around the world the previous year. Sure, the rooms were ok, and I say ok because the bed was a bit of a nightmare and the room was stuffy, but hey, I guess €80 is 'inexpensive' Paris-style. No, what ruined our weekend was the staff at hotel Chatillon, and expecially a baldish guy in I would say his forties. Unfortunately I do not rememeber his name, I would have gladly posted it here as a warning to all other travellers. He was never nice to us and made us feel uncomfortable. We were dressed nicely and were polite but he obviously had it in for us. First of all he seemed offended that we did not want to sign up for the hotel breakfast. We like to have options and I have never been a fan of hotel breakfasts anyways. Hotel staff really should not act like that when you say no to paying an extra €7-8 for a croissant and a cup of coffee. Now, we are young so we like going to a few bars at night. The first evening we came home around 2AM and went quitely to bed, he had to open the door for us but made us feel like there was a curfew and that we had broken it. Come on, we are on holiday for God's sake! The next day we had a nice day around Paris and tried staying away from the hotel as much as we could due to the snobby hotel staff. What really made me leave Paris with a sour taste in my mouth was the last day when we were checking out. He called us from the reception 5 minutes BEFORE checkout time to check if we were out yet. I said we would be down in a few minutes. We hurried as best as we can and when the phone rang again 5 minutes later, at the exact check out time I said we were leaving the room. He made me feel very stressed and also unwanted, and when we were in the reception 5 minutes after check out I thought he was going to yell at us. We were going to pay for the stay then and I said I wanted to go to the ATM, which is a couple of minutes around the corner, to take out cash as I pay high charges and did not want to make two withdrawals as I needed cash for the day as well. He looked at me with disgust and said "Wat is that?* referring to the ATM and I said it is where you take out money using your ATM card. My partner would wait in the reception with our luggage. He did not want me to do this, it was obviously very problematic for him. In the end I was let out so I could get to the ATM and when we paid and left they didn't even say thank you for staying or anything. If you don't like being friendly and service-minded then don'twork ina hotel! What a rude guy, i have never seen anything like it and I have travelled to a lot of places. PLEASE DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful and accommodating”
Reviews.Author: Kimo52
Reviews.Content: I arrived at noon, three hours before check-in during a brief rain shower. As I approached the hotel, one of the staff opened the door for me and showed me where I could leave my umbrella. I was told that check-in time was 3 pm, and was offered a place to leave my luggage, a small sitting room off of the lobby. My cellphone was nearly dead, so I asked if I could recharge it, and was given permission. I sat down and took out my laptop, connected to the hotel WiFi and worked a bit while my phone charged up. As I was working (after maybe 20 minutes), the staff informed me that I could check into my room, I was given a key and shown a very clean, nice, and for Paris standards, spacious room on the third floor (accessible by lift). The only downside was that the WiFi signal, while accessible in the room, would not allow my web-browser to work (for you technophiles, I think the problem was a balky DNS). The lobby WiFi was a separate system (different address, gateway, DNS...), and worked just fine. The hotel is on a cul-de-sac and it's very quiet. The price is excellent, and I would be more than happy to return to the Hotel. Merci!

Reviews.Title: “tiny rooms, but great value, great neighboorhood”
Reviews.Author: KRT23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at this hotel for a total of 8 nights on our honeymoon. It's not the most romantic place we've ever stayed, but it's a great value for Paris, so I'm not complaining! As in all Parisian hotels, the elevator is TINY (fit 130-lb me with 1 rollie-bag); unlike all Parisian hotels, the room we stayed in had an attached bathroom, so that's exciting. :) The neighborhood is largely residential, so it felt like a tiny apartment; there are also some good restaurants nearby (great Italian restaurant; Japanese restaurant with really good sushi!). The cleaning staff insisted on changing our towels and sheets every day, even when we put out the Do Not Disturb sign. Other than that, the hotel staff was really nice. I came down with a really bad cold and the guy at the desk made sure to recommend "an excellent medicine" for me to get at the pharmacy (Sudafed; 1.60€ for a week's worth). My husband thought Desk Guy was nicer to me because I'm female, but I know it's because I tried to speak French every day; they really do appreciate it, even if they switch to English right away.

Reviews.Title: “It's a 2 star hotel for sure with very unpleasant stuff”
Reviews.Author: emaamai
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the Alesia station on the green line (5 -10 min walking). The area is far from the center but clean, with restaurants- you have Mc. Donald, Sturbucks, Pizza Hut, some Italian & Chinese restaurants and cafe's. Also you can make some shopping in this area - Zara, Etam, Promod, Andre and others. The hotel is nice inside (front desk, breakfast room, luggage room) except the rooms. The rooms looks better in the hotel site pictures, but you can be sure it is a true 2 star hotel. The double room has a bed (double, a little hard), a desk with chair, a tv plasma with only french channels (not even an MTV or other music channel) and a wardrobe. The carpet is very ugly and looks very cheap and I didn't like at all the bathroom (no improvements at all). The big minus for the hotel is the stuff, there was an arrogant guy there. For example - when we tried to pay the hotel he didn't want to receive 500 Euro (so take care not to pay the hotel with 500), and when we ask why he said not to waist his precious time...come on..We paid with the card but his attitude made us left from Paris not so happy. When we choose this hotel we thought is a good value for money because it was very nice in the pictures and we preferred it even was far from the center. But I can assure the hotel doesn't look so nice so you can find something better for this price and close to the center because you have a lot to see and not waist time it in the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Great alternative!”
Reviews.Author: LeftyTravels
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel because it felt like home- as if i went out during the day to explore Paris and had a nice, safe, clean retreat to retire to in the suburbs (even though the hotel is still in the city, it is relatively quiet compared to the other areas that are TEEMING with tourists!). Even though I was there in 30 degree weather, the 5-7 minute walk to the metro was no big deal, and the metro is so freakin' efficient that I did not mind AT ALL. we had friends staying in the center of the latin quarter, and while their hotel was more convenient for a relaxing 20 minutes in the middle of the day, there was basically no difference between our two paris experiences, except we probably paid less than half of what they did! the hotel is clean and adorable and quiet, and the front desk man was helpful and did not hesitate to tell me how much he loves Sex and the City, upon hearing we were from NYC. montparnasse is definitely residential and we did not spend much time in the 'hood, but the breakfast we got there one morning was WAY cheaper than in downtown Paris. my only complaint was no hairdryer anywhere in the hotel- I am by no means high-maintenance, but it was 30 degrees outside and I was traipsing around Paris with a wet head!!! I highly recommend this place for many reasons!

Reviews.Title: “April in Paris”
Reviews.Author: JackFrostSweden
Reviews.Content: Good service, evryone smiles. Nice and tidy room, a bit small though. Nice and quiet location near the metro. Good service but poor breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mariaar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Chatillon for 4 nights now in april, and we were satisfied. The first impression we got was a very nice staff. We were on a late flight, so we couldn´t arrive at the hotel before twelwe at night which was later than the Hotel's ordinary rules. This was absolutely no problem for them. They were also very helpful in giving advices anc guidelines. The room was small, but still very clean and fresh. The breakfast was not included in the overall price, but we still decided to eat the hotels breakfast since it would have costed just as much to eat out. The area which the Hotel was located in was calm and friendly, but a bit outside the inner center of Paris. But since the closest metro (Alésia) was situated on a very good subway line, this wasn't a problem. Although, there was one thing that disturbed us. Since we were three people sleeping in one room, we asked for an extra bed. This didn´t sound as a problem, and the room imformation said it was a 2 plus room. But what we didn´t know was that actually we were paying 20 euros each night for this bed. We were under the impression that it was free. Overall, though, this Hotel was worht its price and we would absolutely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: sineas
Reviews.Content: One of my friends and I spent in this hotel 3 nights in the beginning of April. We were absolutely satisfied. The hotel and the rooms are spotlessly clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was prepared every morning...bagette, croissant, juice, cafe, butter and jam. Typical French. The only problem: the walls are thin, you can hear whatever your neighbors do or say. The gentleman at the reception desk offered us a nice restaurant nearby -Escapade. If you don't speak French well the waitress helps you to choose. We didn't know exactly what we ate but we liked it very much. From the hotel we could reach metro and tramway stations easily, we could go to Versailles or Montmartre with only one connection. From Orly airport we traveled by Orlybus to Denfert Rochereau then to Alésia by metro. The hotel is appr. 5 minutes from this station, so it has a very convenient location. There are no hairdryer and minibar in the room but we didn't miss them. Overall this is a nice, friendly and recently renovated hotel, great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but slightly rude and moved us without our knowledge”
Reviews.Author: mcrat
Reviews.Content: We stayed between the 12 and 18 of march, in a double room and it is a nice hotel in a good location close to a metro stop on the number 4 line which connects with all the other metro line so it is very convenient. The only problem we had with the hotel was that we had went out early one day around 9 and didn't return until around 8 that night. We got our key from reception (as you have to leave the key when you go out), went up to our room and found that all the furniture had been moved into the middle of the room and cover in plastic sheets and the room recently painted with all the equipment still in the room. We went back to reception to find that we were listed under a different room and when we went up with that key, we found all our things in the new room. Obviously this was an inconvienece but the main problem was when we spoke with the manager/owner the next day, and said we were unhappy that we hadn't been told about the move. He just said yes i know you were moved but we needed to paint. When we paid the bill there was a nights reduction from the price but i'm not totally sure if that was the deposit we paid. But the room was nice and most of the staff were friendly. The only other odd thing was the codes for the safes were all listed in the reception and you couldn't changve the one you were giving so anyone who could see this list kenw the codes for all the safes.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Chatillon provides very good all round service”
Reviews.Author: travellersManchester
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short break in Paris. This hotel is well situated to the south of the city with very good links into it on the metro. Can't fault the cleanliness, style and service. Recently renovated in the Parisian style it provides a good base for people wanting to see more than just the centre of Paris. There are a small number of bistros and restaurants just a short walk away, and if you travel four stops on the metro you are in the centre of Montparnasse with a large choice of restaurants,bistros and café's. Would certainly use again.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Paris”
Reviews.Author: DavidCl19
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights recently, and can thoroughly recommend this hotel. Although south of the centre, it is very easy to get to, only several hundred metres from a metro (Alesia) and buses, directly to Gard du Nord and the centre of the city. The location is very quiet, tucked away in a square, so we slept well every night. The rooms are larger than usual for Paris, and very clean and comfortable. Staff were friendly and spoke good English. The breakfast was French, which was fine for us, but not for those wanting bacon and eggs! Note that the hotel is very close to the new tram line running just inside the Peripherique, which is very useful to get around the outer edge of the city: combined with the PC1 bus which runs along the same road this is a great way to get to sights away from the centre - we used it to get to the Musee Marmottan and the Bois de Bolougne, where we spent a delightful couple of hours cycling around (bikes for hire there). This was nice after a few days sightseeing in the centre. All in all I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel, definately worth the money”
Reviews.Author: vreni10
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for four nights at the end of February 2009. We arrived at about 10pm which was no problem for the receptionists. We were given the room keys and booked the breakfast for €7. The room was ok in size, with two single beds as booked. One closet with enough room to hang clothes and also plenty of shelves inside. There was also a safe to be used. For the safe, you need to get the code at the reception and you have to use the one you get there which I did not understand to be very safe... But after my second inquiry, they assured me that they never had problems with that, and neither did we. There could be one more chair in the room, so two chairs for two persons would be good. The bathroom was very big, but the shower very small. I am a women of "normal" figure and for me it was ok. But I imagine a man with north european height of about 1,90m or more would be a little bit squeezed in... Breakfast was absolutely ok and worth the money, you get a croissant, a pain au chocolat, half a baguette, fruit jam and butter. For drinks you can choose between tea, coffee or chocolate. No müsli or fresh fruits are offered, but as I saw some other guests brought this with them and this was also no problem for the staff. The hotel is situated in a dead-end street and therefore is very calm. The metro station is about 5 minutes walk and the walk is in a nice area with cafes, restaurants and shops. The trip from the metro station near the hotel to Gare de l'est takes about 20 minutes. In total, this hotel was absolutely great for our short stay in Paris. If I go to Paris again, I would definately stay there again and also recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet suburban hotel, but only 20 minutes from the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Tobias08
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the other reviews on Trip Advisor, which were in the main very positive, and I would have to agree. The hotel was easy to find although it is tucked away in a quiet cul-de-sac. When we arrived at 11.30am a room was ready and it turned out to be a good sized double room, not two singles stuck together which is prevalent in Europe. Madame was running reception and explained what we needed to know in slow French which was understandable to us. The staff were all friendly and helpful, and as I said earlier, the hotel was very quiet. The only quibble we had was the heat in the room, which caused one bad nights sleep, but once we turned off the radiator it was fine. The breakfast at 7 Euros sounds a lot, but bearing in mind cafe's will charge the same for a coffee and a croissant, it is worth it. The local area is not particularly exciting, just a suburb, but the metro is 5 minutes walk away with a Champion supermarket on the way, and there is a very nice restaurant called l'Escapade about 2 minutes in the other direction. We ate there twice (the first time we were the only customers), and the food was excellent and good value at 35 euros for 2 courses with wine for both of us. Essentially this is a no frills hotel, but it is quiet, clean and welcoming, and a lot better value than many I have stayed at in London.

Reviews.Title: “good experience, good location”
Reviews.Author: illes_ferenc
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, and weel located, but almost every lauder noise ( TV, louder conversation ) could be heard from the next room. Otherwise the hotel located in very quiet street, so you can leave the windows open while sleeping. The breakfast was extra, and every day croissant, marmalade, sweet butter, and coffee, tea wasn’t too various for 7 Eur per person. The staff was very friendly. Sum up we were satisfied with this hotel, and will return here. Ferenc Illes, Hungary.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: brafikoto
Reviews.Content: I just saw this recommended page of Hotel Chatillon and I wondered whether you could tell me how you ranked Hotel Chatillon so high. I stayed there with a friend and my daughter from 16th Jan to 19th Jan 2009 and our stay was not enjoyable. Betty, the lady at reception was charming and always professional. She helped us with guides to Paris and potential restaurants we could eat at. However, on arrival to the hotel we were told that buggies could not go to the rooms, which we adhered to and always left the buggy in the front room everytime and also they told us they run a policy of no eating in the rooms. On the 2nd day of our stay we got back really late and could not stop for dinner at a restaurant, as my daughter was tired. We decided to buy a snack to eat at the hotel. On return to the hotel the receptionist very rudely asked us whether we had brought any food back which we said we had and then he went on to question us as to whether we did not know there was a no eating policy in the rooms. As we had had breakfast in the dining room, we had assumed that we could eat in the dining room, we told him. He refused point blank and brushed past us into the foyer, saying he had had enough in French. Unfortunately for him, I understand and speak fluent French. He then proceeded to tell us to go and find a cafe in the neighbourhood at about 11:30pm at night and that he could not allow us to eat there. This was a very awkward and humiliating experience. He then said he would have to call the management to inform them and ask whether we could eat in the dining room. At this point we decided to go out to have our snack. There were no cafe's open in the area so myself my 3 year old daughter and friend had to sit on a bench at nearly midnight to have our snack. We decided to tell the gentlemen that he had been rude to us and that was unacceptable. The next day, we were not up early enough to go for breakfast and were surprised with a call in the morning, asking us if we wanted our breakfast in bed. What a turn in event. Was this perhaps the result of the extreme rudeness of their personnel. A day later we checked out after our break was over and in my haste to leave, left my tom tom (GPS) in the hotel room safe. I realised on my arrival to the UK, that I had left my tom tom and called the hotel to check this was the case. They confirmed this. Then I made the mistake of asking them if they could send it back to me, if I paid the charges which they vehemently refused and informed me rudely that they were not a courrier service. I phoned TNT who would not do this as I was a domestic customer and phoned DHL who were telling me that it would cost me 85 euros which is half the price of the tom tom. I therefore decided to find alternative ways of returning my tom tom through my brother's wife, who has family in Paris. I again asked the hotel if they could send the tom tom to the address in Paris, so this could be returned to me,....The receptionist (male)cut me short telling me that did he not tell me to use DHL, to which I explained the costing issue, he then proceeded to rudely tell me that if I had family, then I could get them to come over to collect the tom tom and put the phone down. I rest my case. Where is the customer service in this experience.....I will never go back to Hotel Chatillon or recommend them to anyone. I for one do not think they warrant the ratings they have and I hope that you make them aware.

Reviews.Title: “Delightfully decorated; superb staff”
Reviews.Author: Michael_177
Reviews.Content: The hotel is tucked in a quiet yet lively area. I stayed for 4 nights in mid December 2008. It's a charming and inviting hotel that is immaculately decorated. The rooms are larger than usual in Paris and I experienced excellent, helpful service from all staff. Even the young lady busy in the kitchen one morning... our eyes happened to meet, and she gave a courteous and respectful, "Bonjour, Monsieur' which I returned in kind. (In some places or countries sometimes this is an uncomfortable moment for staff or the culture is just different, and they immediately look away.) I found the greeting refreshing and it helped make me feel 'at home, away from home'. Also, the WIFI was good- which is essential nowadays. It was a good price (included, I think) and was a key reason for me choosing this hotel. Truly a pleasant stay, and I look forward to my next trip.
